## 1. Load in libraries and file path.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

# may need to install these
library(Rcpp)       # For c++ integration
library(RcppEigen)  # Ditto
library(tidyverse)  # For dataframe manipulation
library(gridExtra)  # For plotting purposess 
library(here)       # For c++ integration

```

## 2. Load the data, posteriors and model

```{r}

# To help with plots
source(here::here("R", "plot_helpers.R"))

# Load in data
load(file = here::here("data", "hodgson20", "posteriors.RData")) # The posteriors from the RSV model with altered data
load(file = here::here("data", "hodgson20", "rsv_data_uk.RData"))   # Load in model data, including observation data (which is made up i.e. not the same as I used in the paper).
load(file = here::here("data", "hodgson20", "prior_data_uk.RData"))   # Load in model data, including observation data (which is made up i.e. not the same as I used in the paper).

# Load in the epidemic model from c++ and update important parameters
# Need to have boost installed on computer. Can install via homebrew.
# Might throw loads of [-Wunknown-pragmas] warnings, just ignore, usually an issue with the coompiler.
sourceCpp(here("src", "logLikelihoodModule_hodgson.cpp")) #ensure c++14 is enabled
classEvaluateLogLikelihood <- new(EvaluateLogLikelihood, ukdata$numberDailyLiveBirths, ukdata$population, ukdata$ageGroupBoundary) # Calls class
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$contactMatrixPhy <- ukdata$contactMatrixPhy
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$contactMatrixCon <- ukdata$contactMatrixCon
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$observedData <- as.matrix(ukdata$observationalData)
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$lowerParamSupport <- priordata$fit.par$lowerParSupport
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$upperParamSupport <- priordata$fit.par$upperParSupport
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$run_start <- 0
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$run_burn <- 52 * 7 + 1;
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$run_oneyr <- 52 * 7 + classEvaluateLogLikelihood$run_burn;
classEvaluateLogLikelihood$run_full <- 7 * 52 * 7 # number of days to fit the data and model to

```

## 3. Generate images in figs folder
### 3.1 Plot the poseterior distirbutions

```{r}

# Won't run right now as I only ran one chain
library(coda)
library(bayesplot)
start <- floor(nrow(output1[[1]][[1]]) / 2)
end <- nrow(output1[[1]][[1]])
all_pars <- colnames(output1$mcmc[[1]]) 

color_scheme_set("red")
mcmc_post <- output1$mcmc %>% map(~.x[start:end, ] )
gelman.diag(output1$mcmc)[[1]]

transmission_param <- c("xi", "si", "g0", "g1", "g2", "om", "pA1", "pA2", "pA3", "pA4", "alpha_i", "d1", "d2", "d3" "phi", "qp", "qc", "psi", "b1", "l1", "l2" )
tp_trans <- c(
    "xi" = "xi",
    "si" = "si",
    "g0" = "g[0]",
    "g1" = "g[1]",
    "g2" = "g[2]",
    "om" = "om",
    "pA1" = "pA[1]",
    "pA2" = "pA[2]",
    "pA3" = "pA[3]",
    "pA4" = "pA[4]",
    "alpha_i" = "alpha",
    "d1" = "d[1]",
    "d2" = "d[2]",
    "d3" = "d[3]",
    "phi" = "phi",
    'qp' = 'q[p]', 
    'qc' = 'q[c]',
    "psi" = "psi", 
    "b1" = "b[1]", 
    "l1" = "l[1]", 
    "l2" = "l[2]"
  )
my_labeller_tp <- as_labeller(
  x = tp_trans,
  default = label_parsed
)

detection_param <- c("c5ep1", "c5ep2", "ep5", "ep6")

dp_trans <- c(
    "c5ep1" = "Aepsilon[1]",
    "c5ep2" = "Bepsilon[2]",
    'ep5' = 'epsilon[5]',
    'ep6' = 'epsilon[6]' 
    )
my_labeller_dp <- as_labeller(
  x = dp_trans,
  default = label_parsed
)

post1 <- mcmc_dens_overlay(mcmc_post, pars = transmission_param, facet_args = list(labeller = my_labeller_tp))
ggsave(post1, file = here::here("figs", "hodgson20", "post", "trans.pdf"))


post2 <- mcmc_intervals(mcmc_post, pars = detection_param, point_size = 2) + 
  scale_y_discrete(labels = detection_param)
ggsave(post2, file = here::here("figs", "hodgson20", "post", "detect.pdf"))

trace1 <- mcmc_trace(mcmc_post, pars = transmission_param,  facet_args = list(labeller = my_labeller_tp))
trace2 <- mcmc_trace(mcmc_post, pars = detection_param,  facet_args = list(labeller = my_labeller_dp))

ggsave(trace1, file = here::here("figs", "hodgson20", "post", "trace_trans.pdf"))
ggsave(trace2, file = here::here("figs", "hodgson20", "post", "trace_detect.pdf"))


```

# Plot functions manual

```{r}

post_long_par <- output1[[1]][[1]] %>% as.data.frame %>%
  pivot_longer(everything(), values_to = "values", names_to = "parameters")

for (p in seq_len(length(priordata$fit.par$namesOfParameters))) {
  post_long_par %>% filter(parameters == priordata$fit.par$namesOfParameters[p]) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = values)) +
    geom_histogram() + labs(title = paste0("Posterior sample for ",priordata$fit.par$namesOfParameters[p]))
  ggsave(here("figs", "hodgson20", "posteriors", paste0(priordata$fit.par$namesOfParameters[p], ".pdf")))
}

```

### 3.2 Plot the weekly incidences using the posterior samples.

```{r}

## run_sample is in plot_helpers.R file
est_ep <- run_sample_weekly(output1[[1]][[1]], TRUE) # Predicted number of positive samples (useful for comparing the model-predicted incidence with the data)
est <- run_sample_weekly(output1[[1]][[1]], FALSE)  # Predicted incidence

# Output the figs for each age group
for (a in 1:25) {
  dataplot <- data.frame(model_m = est_ep[[a]][2,], model_l = est_ep[[a]][1,], model_u = est_ep[[a]][3,], 
    data = ukdata$observationalData[,  a + 1], time = c(1:364))
  
  ggplot() +
    geom_point(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, y = data, color = 'black'), size=0.5, alpha=0.5) +
    geom_line(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, y = model_m, color = 'red'), size=0.4, linetype="dotted") +
    geom_line(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, y = model_l), color = 'red', size=0.4, alpha=0.5) +
    geom_line(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, y = model_u), color = 'red', size=0.4, alpha=0.5) +
    geom_ribbon(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, ymin = model_l, ymax=model_u), fill="red", alpha=0.5) + 
    scale_colour_manual(name = 'Hello', values =c('black'='black','red'='red'), labels = c('Observational data','Model-predicted')) + 
    xlab('Week') + ylab('Estimated number of weekly new positive samples') + ggtitle(paste("Age group", a))
  
  ggsave(here("figs", "hodgson20", "compar", paste0("inci_", a, ".pdf")))
}

# Output the figs for each age group
for (a in 1:25) {

  dataplot <- data.frame(model_m = est[[a]][2, ], model_l = est[[a]][1, ], model_u = est[[a]][3, ], time = c(1:364))
  
  ggplot() +
    geom_line(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, y = model_m, color = 'red'), size=0.4, linetype="dotted") +
    geom_line(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, y = model_l), color = 'red', size=0.4, alpha=0.5) +
    geom_line(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, y = model_u), color = 'red', size=0.4, alpha=0.5) +
    geom_ribbon(data = dataplot, aes(x = time, ymin=model_l, ymax=model_u), fill="red", alpha=0.5) + 
    xlab('Week') + ylab('Estimated number of weekly new infections') + ggtitle(paste("Age group", a))
  
   ggsave(here("figs", "hodgson20", "pred", paste0("inci_", a, ".pdf")))
}

```
